message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.DS

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new method for semi-supervised classification using graph convolutional neural networks. Additionally, the paper also incorporates spectral graph theory, which is a common technique used in machine learning research. 

The paper may also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it specifically mentions social and citation networks as examples of graph-structured data. 

Furthermore, the paper may be relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it proposes a new method for learning graph structures, which is a common problem in AI research. 

The paper may also be relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it uses neural networks to perform semi-supervised classification. 

Finally, the paper may be relevant to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as it deals with the problem of irregularity in graph-structured data, which is a common problem in data structures and algorithms research.
